senses.de: A chance or situation involving such a chance that could cause harm, danger or loss
senses.ex: They decided to take the risk and invest in the new company.

Tips.title: Emotional Weight
Tips.description: The noun 'risk' often carries a sense of tension or worry about a possible negative outcome.
Tips.example: Despite the risks, the thrill-seeker jumped off the cliff.

Tips.title: Risk vs Danger
Tips.description: 'Risk' implies a possibility, while 'danger' is more immediate and serious.
Tips.example: Learning to drive involves some risk, but speeding is outright dangerous.

Tips.title: Risk Measurement
Tips.description: Often, 'risk' is mentioned alongside adjectives that measure it like 'high' or 'low'.
Tips.example: Skydiving is a high risk activity, but with proper equipment, the risk is minimized.

senses.de: To expose to the chance of injury or loss
senses.ex: He risked his life to save the child from the fire.

Tips.title: Risking as a Choice
Tips.description: Using 'risk' as a verb shows a conscious decision to challenge potential negative outcomes.
Tips.example: She risked criticism by presenting her unconventional idea.

Tips.title: Assumed Responsibility
Tips.description: When you 'risk' something, it shows personal involvement and responsibility for the outcome.
Tips.example: He risked his reputation by supporting the controversial project.

senses.de: A person or thing considered likely to bring a bad result
senses.ex: With his reckless driving, he's considered a risk on the road.

Tips.title: Negative Connection
Tips.description: This 'risk' noun form is often linked with negative consequences or attributes.
Tips.example: Due to his past, the parolee was deemed a risk to the community.

Tips.title: Risk Identification
Tips.description: Terms like 'health risk' or 'insurance risk' help categorize the type of risk being discussed.
Tips.example: Smoking is a major health risk that can lead to multiple diseases.

senses.de: A situation or person covered by an insurance policy
senses.ex: The insurance company calculated the risk before issuing the policy.

Tips.title: Insurance Specifics
Tips.description: In insurance, 'risk' refers to the likelihood and potential cost of an insured event.
Tips.example: The flood-prone area was classified as a high-risk zone by the insurance agency.

Tips.title: Calculating Risk
Tips.description: Insurance companies use statistics to decide how risky to consider a person or situation.
Tips.example: Young drivers often face higher premiums as they represent a higher risk.

senses.de: To do something potentially harmful with the hope of a beneficial result
senses.ex: The company decided to risk entering the foreign market.

Tips.title: Business Ventures
Tips.description: In a business context, 'risk' often relates to financial stakes and the uncertainty of success.
Tips.example: Investors were wary of the risk associated with the startup's bold plan.

Tips.title: Calculated Risk
Tips.description: Businesspeople make informed decisions on 'risk' to gain rewards, acknowledging potential losses.
Tips.example: She took a calculated risk by investing in the fluctuating cryptocurrency market.

Certainty.wordDefinition:
Certainty is a state of being sure or confident that something will happen or is true. For example, if you have studied for an exam and are confident you know the material well, you can say you are certain you will do well on the exam.

Certainty is applicable when you have enough information to be sure of something, while risk is applicable when you are considering the potential for negative outcomes.

Certainty gives you confidence, while risk requires careful consideration and weighing of potential consequences.

Danger.wordDefinition:
Danger refers to a situation that has the potential to cause harm or injury. For example, if you're out in a thunderstorm, there's a danger of being struck by lightning.

However, danger refers to the actual harmful situation, while risk is the likelihood of that danger occurring.

Exposure.wordDefinition:
Exposure means coming into contact with something that has the potential to cause harm, such as germs or toxic chemicals.

Risk is the likelihood that that exposure will actually result in harm. So exposure is something that happens, while risk is the chance that something bad will happen because of that exposure.

For example, if you are exposed to the flu virus, you have a risk of getting sick from it. Another example: if you smoke cigarettes, your exposure to harmful chemicals is high, and your risk of developing lung cancer is also high.

Hazard.wordDefinition:
A hazard is something that has the potential to cause harm. For example, a sharp knife is a hazard because it can cut someone.

Risk is the likelihood or probability that someone will be harmed by a hazard. For instance, if someone uses a sharp knife to cut vegetables and is careful to keep their fingers away from the blade, the risk of being harmed is low.

Hazard refers to the potential danger while risk refers to the chance of harm. Both terms are used in safety and health contexts to evaluate and manage potential dangers.

Jeopardy.wordDefinition:
Jeopardy refers to a situation in which there is a danger of losing something valuable or of being harmed. It usually applies to situations that are more serious or high stakes, such as a life-threatening situation, legal troubles, or financial ruin.

For example, there is a risk of getting a speeding ticket if you drive too fast, but you aren't necessarily in jeopardy of losing your life or livelihood.

In summary, Jeopardy is a more severe term and is typically used in more serious situations, while risk is a broader term that can apply to a variety of scenarios.

Menace.wordDefinition:
Menace refers to something that is likely to cause harm or danger, either intentionally or unintentionally. It often has a negative connotation and implies a threat or danger to safety or well-being.

For example, a dangerous dog in the neighborhood is a menace as it poses a threat to people's safety.

Menace denotes a direct threat or danger, while risk refers to a potential hazard or uncertain outcome.

Peril.wordDefinition:
Peril refers to immediate and serious danger, while risk refers to the likelihood of harm or loss.

For example, if you are standing on the edge of a cliff, you are in peril because falling off the cliff would result in immediate danger to your life.

Peril is applicable when there is a clear and present danger that requires immediate action to avoid harm or loss, while risk is applicable when there is a possibility of harm or loss, but it may not be immediate or certain.

Threat.wordDefinition:
Risk refers to the probability or chance of something bad happening, whereas a threat refers to something that has the potential to cause harm or danger.

For example, if you walk across a busy street without looking both ways, there is a risk of getting hit by a car. If someone threatens to harm you, that is a threat to your safety.

Risk can refer to a wide range of possibilities, both positive and negative, while threat specifically refers to danger or harm.

Risk is more applicable when assessing the likelihood of a particular outcome, while a threat is more applicable when evaluating potential sources of danger or harm.

quotes.Text: It's very important for people to know themselves and understand what their value system is, because if you don't know what your value system is, then you don't know what risks are worth taking and which ones are worth avoiding.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: My decision to end my marriage was such a risk to lose ratings and lose my fan base. I had to take that risk for my inner peace and to be happy with myself.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Kim Kardashian

quotes.Text: No man is worth his salt who is not ready at all times to risk his well-being, to risk his body, to risk his life, in a great cause.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.Text: I'm not saying that love always takes you to heaven. Your life can become a nightmare. But that said, it is worth taking the risk.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Novelist
quotes.Name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.Text: I'm lucky to have family around me. Otherwise, I'll be taking the risk of falling in love with myself.
quotes.Title: Musician
quotes.Name: Shakira

quotes.Text: During the first period of a man's life the greatest danger is not to take the risk.
quotes.Title: Danish Philosopher
quotes.Name: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.Text: I've always taken risks, and never worried what the world might really think of me.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Cher

quotes.Text: There are some things worthy of risking your life for.
quotes.Title: American Astronaut
quotes.Name: John M. Grunsfeld

quotes.Text: You can't get anywhere in life without taking risks.
quotes.Title: English Model
quotes.Name: Esme Bianco

quotes.Text: Risking your life is not an easy thing to do.
quotes.Title: North Korean Activist
quotes.Name: Park Yeon-mi
